body.p: Under the recognition principle in paragraph 16, an entity does not recognise in the carrying amount of an investment property the costs of the day‑to‑day servicing of such a property. Rather, these costs are recognised in profit or loss as incurred. Costs of day‑to‑day servicing are primarily the cost of labour and consumables, and may include the cost of minor parts. The purpose of these expenditures is often described as for the ‘repairs and maintenance’ of the property.
